metadata.Title: CVE-2023-44487 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
The HTTP/2 protocol allows a denial of service (server resourceconsumption) because request cancellation can reset many streams quickly,as exploited in the wild in August through October 2023.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-44487` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

haproxy - 2.4.22-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
vim-haproxy - 2.4.22-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: haproxy package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.22-0ubuntu0.22.04.2').
tomcat9 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
trafficserver package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
h2o package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
dotnet6 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.0.123-0ubuntu1~22.04.1').
dotnet7 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.112-0ubuntu1~22.04.1').
nghttp2 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.43.0-1ubuntu0.1').
